dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: DEBO is laid out on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the movies, when you beat up the neighborhood bully; you suppose to live happily ever after.  But around here; that's when all the drama begins... Blue and red police lights flash over Debo's body.  Two sheriffs walk INTO OUR FRAME and stand over Debo.  They f their lights on him. CRAIG (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last Friday; I got fired for the first time.  I got high for the first time.  I got shot at for the first time and I kicked Debo's ass for the first time... They get him to his feet; but he stumbles and falls in th bushes like a knocked out prize fighter.  The sheriffs la at him. Debo looks dazed and confused.  The sheriffs help him out bushes and start to cuff him. CRAIG (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the man that night; and Debo ended up going to jail for a couple of years. But he told Ezal he was getting out next Friday.  He said, when he see me, he was gonna smoke me on the spot... They walk him OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAIG (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And today is next Friday...

dialogues.speaker: SOUNDTRACK
dialogues.text: "New Line Cinema presents, etc., etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING CREDITS.  It's early Friday morning and the sun p over the LA skyline.  As the city starts to awake and the credits continue to roll; we see SEVERAL SHOTS of the real people who make up Los Angeles.  It seems that they all move to the same beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo is released from the Twin Towers County Jail.  Still his orange jumpsuit, he walks right past us and down the street.  Everybody clears his path. SOUNDTRACK still PUMPIN'. Debo crosses the street passing an old man dancing and directing traffic.  Debo stops, the man starts to dance i front of him.  He stares for a second, then he's on his w Still walking tall and hard, he trips over a crack in the sidewalk (losing cool points). Three little black girls in plaid uniforms practice the latest dance steps on their way to school.  Debo is walki towards them.  They scream and take off in the other direction.  He smiles.  Briefly. Still walking; he stops at a corner.  A SA boy waits to c with his low-rider bike.  A Metrolink train passes.  Afte goes by; we see Debo riding off on the boy's bike.  He's the ground holding his eye. Debo continues to ride through the city. He turns a corner or two and comes to a stop at Craig's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones' dog catcher's truck sits in front of the house A CHIHUAHUA (like the Taco Bell dog) takes a dump on the lawn.  It starts to BARK at Debo.  He looks down at the d and kicks him in the street.  The DOG YIPES! Debo focuses his attention on Craig's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is clear and quiet, until MR. JONES (Craig's father), storms out of the bedroom.  He struggles to put his dog catcher's uniform.  He stops at the bathroom door knocks hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!  Craig!  Off yo' ass and on yo' feet; this ain't the time to beat your meat! Mr. Jones laughs at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be out in about 35-40 minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up; today is Fri-day!  And we gotta hit the high-way! Mr. Jones continues on his way; dancing to the beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands crack open a $20 sack of bud onto the magazine.  A of Zigzags fall INTO FRAME.  Papers are ripped from the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the doctor of this delicate operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as my pops found out what Debo said to Ezal, he wanted me to move with my uncle and little cousin in Rancho Cucamonga.  Til' things calm down, or Debo went back to prison.  Whichever comes first. He's sitting on the toilet (dressed: not using it) puttin the finishing touches on his masterpiece.  He licks, roll and slides the 'J into the fifth pocket on his Levi jeans CRAIG (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like the biggest punk around here. I wiped Debo's ass.  He should be the one moving. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens.  Mr. Jones walks out the door, yell back into the house. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!  Let's go!  I don't wanna hit that traffic. He steps off the porch backwards and into "fresh Chihuahu shit."  He slips and falls on the grass. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I be got damn. Mr. Jones gets up.  He brushes the grass off his uniform. looks clean, but when he turns around dog shit is smashed over his back and butt. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!  Craig! Craig emerges from the house with his bags in hand. CRAIG (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I come! MR. JONES (still mad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well bring yo' ass on... Craig slams the door and starts towards the truck. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in some mud.  Now hurry up! Mr. Jones gets in the truck.  Craig jumps in.  They back and pull off.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE-UP ON CRAIG
dialogues.text: He's daydreaming about Smokey. CRAIG (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't wanna leave my neighborhood at all.  Especially my homeboy Smokey.  But he went to rehab last week.  I know I'mma miss him... Out of nowhere, Debo jumps in front of the truck.  Mr. Jo slams on the BRAKES. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!  Get out the car, boy!  This the rematch! Debo reaches for his shank.  Craig turns to Mr. Jones! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, punch it! Mr. Jones floors it and hits Debo.  He falls over the hoo off the car and in the street.  The yellow truck speeds o Debo jumps up staggering with scrapes and bruises. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'mma find you!  You can run ya' can't hide!

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN CAR
dialogues.text: Craig screams out the window. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fake ass Suge Knight! Mr. Jones is a bit shaken up. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That nigga worst than them damn pit bulldogs or something!  That's why moving wit'cha Uncle Elroy and Cousin Day-Day is the best thing for you right now. CRAIG (with attitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll making me look like a punk. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't about being a punk, son.  It's about this... Craig smells something in the air. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My great, great grand daddy on my Momma side; had a saying... 'See a fool -- leave a fool.'  Somebody else a get him. Plus, I don't want that fool shooting at my house trying to hit yo' ass. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell? Mr. Jones sniffs. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be your upper lip, 'cause I don't smell nothing. CRAIG (holding his nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it smell like? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like you didn't fall in no mud. Mr. Jones grabs the air freshener from under the seat.  H starts to spray too much.  Craig's window won't roll down CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with the window? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get'em fixed.  They don't roll down. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All damn. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the freeway and pass a sign that reads, "Rancho Cucamonga" (the city away from the city).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the suburbs.  Where the "Smiley Happy People" in peace and quiet. The neighborhood is full of green lawns and nice two stor track homes as far as the eye can see.  The yellow truck drives through the streets and pulls up to a cul-de-sac. Jones BLOWS the HORN. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice neighborhood, huh? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18-years of chasing dogs; and my lazy ass brother hits the lotto his first time playing.  I still can't figure that one out. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why they got to have the loudest house on the block! Uncle Elroy's house is royal blue with gold trim.  All th other houses are painted in earth tones. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, son, don't be no hater.  You know your uncle ain't got no taste.  Just don't let him rub off on you. Craig grabs his bags. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming in? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'mma go on to work.  I don't wanna hear Elroy's mouth.  Now listen to me, Craig.  It's gonna be different living over here.  Don't let your uncle and your cousin get you into no shit.  Understand? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pops, I'm grown.  Can't nobody get me in trouble no more. As craig gets out;  the front door flies open.  It's DAY- (22), Craig's crazy younger cousin.  He yells back into t house. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, Craig is here. Day-Day walks out to the car and gives Craig a pound. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's crackin'? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  Hi, Uncle Willie. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Day-Day.  Where's yo' big head father? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. Just then, UNCLE ELROY (42) hits the door.  Dressed in bo and a T-shirt.  This is Mr. Jones' (very loud) little brother. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Debo, heard you running from a ass- whippin'? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, it ain't like that. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you see that boy again, bite off his ear off like Mike Tyson. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll remember that. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me?  I would've shot his big ass. (peeking into the ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Willie, how's it going?  Still steppin' in dog shit every day? Uncle Elroy laughs.  Mr. Jones isn't amused. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you look after my son out here. Don't get him involved with none of your bullshit, Roy. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry 'bout nothin', big bro.  He in the best fuckin' hands in Rancho Chocomunga, baby!  This my world, you just a nigga late paying rent.  Ain't that right, nephew? Uncle Elroy hugs Craig by the arm. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, remember what I told you. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll remember. Mr. Jones pulls off.  Uncle Elroy yells out to him. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send Betty my love. (to Craig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy you looking good. (grabbing his bags)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma take these in the house for you, man... and when you finish with this cat, come inside.  I got something to show you. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Unc. Uncle Elroy starts towards to the house. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's been over a year since we kicked it last?  Up at the family reunion. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, that's when Uncle Elroy cussed out everybody, and threw up in Aunt Faye's backseat. Day-Day laughs. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  I forgot about him cussin' out everybody.  Damn that was fun. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, we had a good time.  But ever since you guys moved out here, it seems like we've lost touch. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know; this a long way from Watts.  But what I like about living out here is that you don't hear no helicopters, no sirens, no drive-by's, no nothing.  Just peace and quiet.  Listen. They do.  It is quiet, except for a few BIRDS SINGING. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit sound good, huh? Just then, a maroon Cadillac low-rider on Daytons rolls u the block.  It's the Jokers: JOKER (28), LI'L JOKER (21) BABY JOKER (15).  They pull into their driveway. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw damn. In SLOW MOTION: One by one they get out the car.  They ha dog with them named "Cheeco."  As they get to the front d they all look over at Craig and Day-Day. Day-Day looks away, while Craig keeps his eye on them.  T disappear inside. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joker, he just got out of the pen.  Li'l Joker, he just got out of Youth Authority.  And Baby Joker, he just got out of Juvenile Hall. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ever let you hit the switches on that Cadillac? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, them dudes is assholes.  Especially that dog - Cheeco.  Watch this little ass, he's sneaky.  Plus, I got something better than a Cadillac. They walk over to his black BMW 325i on chrome rims. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This you? DAY-DAY (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's me.  Just a little somethin' somethin' I picked up. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be nice.  I wish we won the lottery. Come up on a million dollars like ya'll. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, after taxes, lawyer fees, and paying off my daddy's bad credit, we didn't end up with a million.  We bought this house and I spent the rest on this.  It's the bomb, huh? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This my baby.  I feel like a new nigga in this car.  I get mo' phone numbers rollin' this, than I ever did on the bus. MISS HO KYM (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Day-Day! They turn to spot MISS HO KYM (67), the old Korean lady w lives next door.  She's sitting on her porch nursing a cu coffee. DAY-DAY (speaking louder and slower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mulan. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Day-Day.  Who's ya boy? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This my cousin, Craig.  He just moved out here from L.A.  Craig, this is Miss Ho. Day-Day smiles at Craig. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Miss Ho Kym.  Day-Day just trying to be a smart ass.  Nice to meet you, Craig.  Are you 'bout it, 'bout it? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said...are you 'bout it, 'bout it -- rowdy, rowdy? Craig can't believe his ears. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm 'bout it. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, it's all good.  Yo, Day-Day, something is going down with those Mexicans across the street?  I've been seeing a lot of activity. They all look over at the Joker's house. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of activity? MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange activity.  I think they running drugs off Tijuana.  Day-Day don't believe me. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know for sure? MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything, playboy.  Don't hate, congratulate. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time, Miss Ho, I'll see you later. Day-Day and Craig start to walk back to the house. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later, Day-Day.  Come by after work, I got the John Blaze shit for you. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you? MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace out, Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day and Craig enter the house.  They still have the furniture from the projects.  Craig looks around.  He spo at a few hanging pictures. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this a cool house. DAY-DAY (picking up a picture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I just wish my mother had a chance to see it. Mother's picture: she looks like Day-Day with a wig on. She's smiling and holding the winning lotto ticket. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when she found out we won the money, she had a heart attack.  You know the story. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. A sad moment. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on and make yourself at home.  I'mma go get dressed for work. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, where you work at? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinky's Records and Disc in the shopping center.  I'mma talk to my boss and see if he got a little position for you.  'Cause you been unemployed for a long time now, Craig. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for reminding me. Day-Day exits.  Craig is left to look around, until somet outside catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's D'WANA (20), Day-Day's six-month pregnant girlfriend She's walking on the right side of his BMW.  With one han she waves at Craig...with the other hand she's keying Day Day's car with the skills of a retarded first-grader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig waves back, but something ain't right.  Uncle Elroy steps in with SUGA (39), his nymphomaniac girlfriend.  Sh wearing a sexy nightie that's a size too small. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, I want you to meet my old lady, Suga.  Suga, this is Craig. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, ba-by! She gives Craig a big, juicy hug and kiss, grabbing his a in the process. SUGA (cont'd) (hugging and grabbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even cuter than your baby pictures. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. SUGA (whispering in Craig's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'mma be your new auntie.  We can keep it all in the family if you want to. Uncle Elroy un-hugs them. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, that's enough.  Go put on some damn clothes. SUGA (pouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elroy. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suga.  Go ahead and get us something to smoke on. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (winking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Craig. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Suga walks out. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that girl's gonna kill me one day. Viagra ain't working.  My back keep going out... she don't never get enough.  But check this out.  I got to lay some ground rules. (gets closer to Craig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your my family and I love you.  You're welcome to anything you want in my home. But I don't wanna catch you in the refrigerator or in my Suga bowl... you feel me knocking? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me in. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy, who's that girl by Day-Day's car? He looks. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's D'Wana.  His ex. (yelling upstairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day, the crazy bitch is back! Day-Day runs down the stairs to get a look.  He's holding piece of paper. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, naw. He runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Wana continues her job.  Day-Day storms over, waving th paper. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, you supposed to be 1000 feet from my house.  What you doing over here? D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it look like I'm doing?  You can't quit me, I'm pregnant! DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my baby! Day-Day spots the damage.  He loses it. DAY-DAY (cont'd) (in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!  What you doing?! Now he's a madman. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch!  You keyed my car!  I'mma kill you! Day-Day charges D'Wana.  She has her pepper spray ready. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your bitch right here. D'Wana sprays his face orange.  He stops in his tracks; g his eyes and screams like a woman. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwwww.... (staggering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwwww.... D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect you to return all phone calls and take me to lunch today.  I'll be back out here on my break.  Nobody quits me. D'Wana runs to her car.  She speeds off.  Uncle Elroy goe for the water hose.  Craig grabs Day-Day. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see!  I can't see!  Daddy! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay down, Day-Day.  Stop moving. Craig puts him on the grass. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pepper-sprayed me, man!  She pepper- sprayed me! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, be still. Before he can say another word, Uncle Elroy nearly drowns with the water hose. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you got you a little fatal attraction, huh?  I had two or three of them in my day. Day-Day is drowning. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, I hope you know how to deal with women better than this fool. Craig moves the hose. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too much water. Now Day-Day is blind and choking. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him to his feet.  Let's get him to the bathroom. They get him up and into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush Day-Day into the shower. DAY-DAY (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  What you doing? Uncle Elroy turns on the cold water.  Day-Day screams.  H tries to get out.  They push him back in. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wet your eyes, boy.  Stay in there for about 20 minutes. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 minutes? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, 20 minutes.  Trust me.  I've been pepper sprayed nine times.  20 minutes. Uncle Elroy slams the door.  Day-Day stands in the shower fully dressed and soaking wet. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you my back yard.  You know it's bigger than y'all back yard. They exit, leaving Day-Day in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy and Craig start to walk around the back yard. the B.G., we NOTICE giant weed plants everywhere. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you gotta have a little money to live out here, Craig.  I never thought I'd be the kinda nigga to move to the suburbs.  But as soon as I got my check, I was gone.  Paid 230 thousand dollars cash on this house. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paid cash? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash money.  They wasn't gonna stick me with no 30-year payment plan.  That's for suckas.  They got my daddy like that for a Cadillac years ago.  I got the only house on the block that's paid for. That's why I'm the king around here. They walk over to the pool. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that pool? It's half-full with dirty water.  An upside-down lawn cha floats in it. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, but where's the water? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need water.  We didn't have no pool in the projects...so none of us swim. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all never use it? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never... (humping the air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But me and Suga can get real nasty in that Jacuzzi, though. The Jacuzzi water has a purple condom floating in it.  Un Elroy reaches over and picks it out. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd) (shaking the water off the condom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You welcome get in it anytime you want to.  Shit, you my brother's son. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Unc.  I can't swim, either. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A run-down crack house sits alone in the middle of the bl It looks deserted with chipped paint, overgrown grass and security bars everywhere.  Inside we can hear a FIGHT in progress. CRACK DEALER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezal, I'm sick of you coming around here wit no money. Suddenly the door flies open and Ezal comes flying out on ass. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I be damned. He gets up and brushes himself off.  He heads back into t crack house. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look here, man.  I'mma preferred customer and I can take my credit card somewhere else. SMACK!  SMACK!  SMACK!  Ezal is roughed up some more and flies through the picture window.  GLASS rains down. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my neck, oh, my back.  Man, I quit! I'm retired!  Officially!  Life shouldn't be this hard for a crackhead! Ezal lays there in pain.  Out of nowhere, a bicycle comes INTO FRAME.  Ezal looks up at the rider.  It's Debo. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did Craig move to? EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Debo. Debo rolls on top of him with the front tire.  Ezal is smashed and in more pain. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say? EZAL (hurting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moved out to Rancho Cucamonga with his cousin Day-Day. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rancho Cucamonga? EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Debo thinks about it. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe. He rolls off of Ezal.  Relief. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, we can't ride to Rancho Cucamonga on that. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on! Ezal hops on the handlebars quick.  They start to ride of EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't go over the curb. Debo rides over the curb and into the street.  The journe begins. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch my balls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day's room is junky.  Clothes are everywhere.  He's putting on his Pinky's Records and Disc T-shirt.  Craig c in. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You straight? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm alright.  Is my face still orange to you? Day-Day's face looks sunburned. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't taste nothing. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with your girlfriend? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's a long story.  I met D'Wana three months ago.  She had a little pudge in her stomach but I didn't pay it no attention.  Come to find out, she six months pregnant.  Saying I'm the daddy! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I broke up with her two Fridays ago and she's been harassing me ever since. She don't care about the restraining order or nothing. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restraining order?  Where the hell you meet this girl? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went back to Watts to sell my old car and met her on the way.  Worst day of my life. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you got a stalker. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't the worst part.  Her little sister, Baby D.  She's the one that gets real physical.  But I got a restraining order on her, too. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a restraining order on a little girl named Baby D? DAY-DAY (very serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Baby D. He looks at his watch. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get to Pinky's before I get fired like you. Day-Day exits.  Craig is close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk out the front door, someone catches Craig's It's KARLA (23), the Joker brothers' fine sister.  She's leaning against the lowrider, looking into her purse.  Sh waves at them. KARLA (friendly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Craig and Day-Day are mesmerized. BOTH (waving back)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Craig and Karla's eyes meet.  She smiles. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the sister. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo know what?  I'm starting to like Rancho Cucamonga. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what 'cha thinking.  I thought the same thing.  But it can't happen. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, it's been a little tension between us ever since they got out the joint and ran their momma crazy.  And I'm just trying to keep the peace.  We moved out here to get away from that shit. Day-Day walks over to his Beamer.  Craig follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big scratch on the side of Day-Day's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't that bad, is it? Craig is still looking at Karla. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!  It ain't that bad, is it? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's bad.  And that scratch make it ugly. Day-Day is starting to get mad. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's long and crooked...make you not wanna even drive it. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright... I see what you talking about. Karla looks at her watch and starts to walk up the street This is Craig's chance. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up, Day-Day. He trots after her. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go. Karla is still walking. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Hey! She stops and waits for him. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Day-Day's cousin, Craig.  What's your name? KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig and Karla, damn that sound pretty good together.  Where you going? KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Cucamonga shopping center. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, why you walking? KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers won't give me a ride. Day-Day is about to have a heart attack.  He's looking ba and forth between Craig and Karla, and the Joker's house where somebody is looking out the window. DAY-DAY (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the number and come on.  Just get the number and come on. Back at the "Love Connection," Craig has Karla smiling. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to give you a ride? KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean, you don't know?  Just wait here. Craig starts to trot over towards Day-Day.  Day-Day is frantically waving Craig to hurry. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you worried about? Day-Day's eyes get as big as golf balls. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeco! Craig turns to see the pit bull "Cheeco" running right af him. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeco, no! Craig runs right towards Day-Day's BMW. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, jump! They both jump on top of Day-Day's BMW with CHEECO coming fast.  He's BARKING viciously.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS STREET
dialogues.text: Joker, Li'l Joker and Baby Joker are across the street laughing.  Karla is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ON BMW
dialogues.text: Craig is breathing hard but he's calm, but Day-Day is terrified. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joker!  Stop playing, man!  Call the dog back! They continue to laugh.  Craig pulls his belt off.  He sw it and hits Cheeco in the middle of his forehead with the buckle.  The DOG CRIES and runs back across the street. The Jokers aren't laughing anymore.  Joker stares at Crai Craig stares back.  You can feel the tension.  Joker kick the dog. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yo dumb ass in the back. CHEECO HOLLERS.  Craig and Day-Day get off the top of the BMW. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my roof. Big dents in the roof of his BMW. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, why you do that?  I told you not to talk to that girl. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  She was cool with it. Day-Day gets into the car. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean, so? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you 'get into it' with them S.A.'s and start a feud, you can always go back to home.  I gotta live here.  Just remember that. He slams the door, starts the car and backs up.  Leaving Craig standing there.  He sees Karla walking away.  He lo over at the Jokers.  They're still staring hard.  Craig j looks away and walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig steps into the house. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nephew, you got perfect timing... Uncle Elroy is sitting on the couch.  He has a Phillies' Blunt (cigar) in one hand, a razor blade in the other. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We about to start a little puff, puff give in this mothafucka.  Are you down? Suga is sippin' on a glass of wine.  She moves over, maki room in the middle. SUGA (patting the couch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Craig.  Sit down right here. Craig does.  Suga moves closer, boxing him in nice and ti Uncle Elroy licks the cigar. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you smoke weed, right? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you say that? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause your lips is getting black. Uncle Elroy takes the razor and starts to cut the cigar t long way. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I smoke is blunts.  Them fuckin' Zigzags don't do nothing for me. Uncle Elroy scrapes the cigar shavings into a nearby tras can (that's overflowing with cigar shavings already).  Su presses against Craig. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a glass of wine, baby? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. It's too early. Uncle Elroy stuffs the open cigar full of weed.  He's concentrating. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I can roll a blunt better than them bitches in Havana.  I know Willie don't let'cha smoke in the house, but I'm ya uncle.  I don't care how high you get in my house.  Long as you let me hit it... He licks and rolls. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. It's perfect. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire it up, Roy. Uncle Elroy grabs the lighter. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'mma show you the real "Puff Daddy." He lights the blunt.  Craig's watching, so is Suga.  Uncl Elroy holds the smoke in for a very long time.  Maybe too long...'cause his eyes start to bulge, and he starts to t (cough with your mouth closed).  And toke.  And toke.  An toke.  It looks like he's about to bust when he lets out big puff of smoke.  Then he starts to cough, and cough, a cough out of control. Craig and Suga are amazed at this display.  Uncle Elroy f to the floor on his hands and knees.  Still coughing.  He falls on his back and passes the blunt to Craig. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd) (still coughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Bombay. Craig takes the blunt and puts it up to his lips.  He hit it, holds it in and looks at Suga.  Suddenly, his eyes bu out and he starts to toke, and toke, and toke, and toke. starts to cough out of control and he falls next to Uncle Elroy who's still coughing.  Craig passes the blunt to Su who looks at it for a moment and then looks directly INTO CAMERA.  (As if to say, "Shiiiiiiiiiiiit.").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three are passed out on the couch.  Uncle Elroy is snoring with a little slobber hanging.  Craig's knocked o with his mouth open.  Suga's head is not secure and she's starting to bob.  She bobs so hard that her head falls in Craig's lap.  He wakes up and looks down. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suga. He looks over at Uncle Elroy who's looking over at him. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negro, what the hell you doing to my woman? CRAIG (confused and dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suga! SUGA (face in lap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing to my nephew? SUGA (lifting her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, baby...I thought this was you. (to Craig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, what are you doing to me? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think I passed out or something.  I don't remember. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passed out?  Can't hang, huh?  Boy, I knew you was a lightweight.  Passed out on one funky ass blunt.  They don't make 'em like they used to, baby. Uncle Elroy staggers to his feet. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, woman.  I'm faded and feeling X- rated.  It's Mr. Nasty time. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Nasty time? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Nasty time. (grabbing his back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But take it easy on me, girl. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, you ain't the only lightweight around here. Suga takes Elroy's hand. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself at home. They both stumble upstairs leaving Craig all alone.  It's quiet now.  He grabs the remote and TURNS ON the TV.  Fli a few channels.  He picks up the blunt and the lighter.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: A public service announcement from King/Drew Rehab Center It's SMOKEY! SMOKEY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, my name is Smokey.  And I'm a bud- head.  But here at the King/Drew Rehab Center, they help you curve your crave for marijuana but still let you get your drank on. He lifts a 22 oz. bottle of Olde English. SMOKEY (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too hard to stop everything all at once.  So some days they let you smoke, but not drank.  And other days you can drank, but not smoke.  And if you're really making progress, the nurses will get fucked up wit you.  Helping you kick the habit by smoking up all yo shit.  So come down to the King/Drew Rehab Center and put down the joint, but B.Y.O.B., man!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON COUCH
dialogues.text: Craig is high.  He's looking at the TV with a slight smil his face.  It seems like the walls are shaking.  He looks over at Suga's glass and her wine is vibrating, like Jura Park.  Plaster falls from the ceiling.  He listens, it's Uncle Elroy and Suga making love. UNCLE ELROY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby, right there.  Right there...bite the nipple, baby.  Bite it! Bite it!  Yeah, mothafucka -- yeah, come on, baby, get busy... His eavesdropping is interrupted by a loud KNOCK on the d Craig is so comfortable, he doesn't want to move.  The KNOCKING gets LOUDER. DELIVERY GUY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Craig gets up slowly and starts to clean the area.  The KNOCKING CONTINUES. DELIVERY GUY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said hold on! DELIVERY GUY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you hurry up, please... it's kinda hot out here. Craig stops what he's doing and swings the door open.

dialogues.speaker: ON PORCH
dialogues.text: The DELIVERY GUY, a thirtysomething asshole with tight sh and a buzz cut, is looking into the house. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? DELIVERY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice house. Didn't expect you to answer. You must be one of those entertainers. What team you play for? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't play for no team. DELIVERY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, jerky, you can tell me.  Got a white wife, huh?  Blonde bombshell type. Remember what happen to O.J... what team do you play for?  You're not related to the Jacksons, are you? CRAIG (in his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I play for the Chocamunga Cracker Killers.  You want tickets? DELIVERY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, buddy.  Don't send your entourage out here to do a 187 on me.  It's just a certified mail delivery. He hands Craig a letter. DELIVERY GUY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here. Craig signs. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? DELIVERY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delinquent Property Tax Notice... I hope the Cracker Killers pay well 'cause if not, back to the ghetto you go.  Wife stays here, of course. He laughs and walks off singing the "Good Times" jingle. DELIVERY GUY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...temporary layoffs?  Good Times...hustling and surviving... Good Times...ain't we lucky we got'em...' Oh shit! Cheeco starts to chase him down the street.  Craig looks the notice.  "DELINQUENT! YOUR HOUSE WILL BE SEIZED AND

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONED
dialogues.text: CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh damn. He SLAMS the DOOR.  We FOLLOW Craig upstairs TO Uncle Elr room.  He knocks softly. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy? No answer. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy, you got a tax notice. Still no answer.  He turns the knob.  It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig steps into Uncle Elroy's freak palace.  Black light candles, velvet posters - the works.  There's even a leat fuck swing hanging from the ceiling.  Uncle Elroy and Sug are asleep in a leopard-skin waterbed.  Craig is amazed. slowly walks over to the bed.  Uncle Elroy is calling the hogs.  Snoring. CRAIG (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy...Uncle Elroy? He's about to shake him when Uncle Elroy lets out a big grunt.  It startles Craig.  He looks over at Suga.  She's completely under the covers.  Uncle Elroy rolls over on h stomach, then he rolls on his back again.  Craig shakes h CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy, wake up.  You got a letter today. No response.  Craig tries again. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unc. Uncle Elroy jumps up like a hibernating grizzly. UNCLE ELROY (half asleep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on here, Suga... He goes after Craig, who has to fight him off. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it rough now. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, naw!  Unc, wake up!  It's me!  Wake up! Uncle Elroy grabs him in a bear hug and slams him on the Craig finds himself caught between Suga and Uncle Elroy, now everything is totally still and quiet.  Uncle Elroy starts to snore again.  He's asleep.  The coast is clear Craig tries to make his escape.  He crawls over Suga to g away.  She grabs him and starts to kiss him. SUGA (half asleep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh, baby! Craig breaks away and tries to hurry out the room.  On hi exit, he hangs himself on the "fuck swing" and hits the f with a thud.  He scrambles to his feet, then he's out of there.  Uncle Elroy and Suga lay asleep as if nothing eve happened.

dialogues.speaker: IN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Craig tries to gain his composure.  He gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo is riding Ezal on the handlebars. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta stop or something, man.  My ass is hurting.  This handlebar is hard. Debo keeps riding. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo!  Debo!  Now you stuck on stupid. He finally stops at a pay phone.  Ezal jumps off and grab his ass. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...gotta walk it out, walk it out. Man, it's gonna take us a week to ride out there. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  He still eats here every day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones' dog truck sits in front. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the plan.  You gonna call over there and say you have a very urgent message for Mr. William Jones. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What urgent message? DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you shut up I'll tell you.  The urgent message is...Drop everything!  Craig is in trouble.  Come quick, don't call. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't gonna work. Debo slaps him in the back of the head. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the number. Smack!  Debo slaps him again. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the outside of the building, now pick the phone up! Ezal picks up the phone.  He starts to dial. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Yeah, I got an urgent message for a nigga named Mr. Willie Jones. Debo slaps him again. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got a urgent message for a customer named William Jones.  Drop everything, Craig is in trouble.  Come quick.  Don't try to call. Ezal hangs up the phone. EZAL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you better stop hittin' on me for I do you like Craig did you. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Debo and Ezal run across the street to the dog truck.  De opens the back and lets all the dogs out.  They run for i DEBO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I get in, close the door. Debo is a hard fit.  Ezal stuffs him in there. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too big. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep pushing. Finally he's in.  Ezal gets in and slams the door shut. then, Mr. Jones comes running out the joint with a sandwi in hand. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! He gets in and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars pull in and out of this 12 store strip mall where Pinky's is located.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is pink inside this mom and pop record store. latest RAP HIT PLAYS in the B.G.  A few people exit the s with bags. Day-Day is scanning inventory.  A bud-head by the name of ROACH is on top of the counter with his skateboard. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Day-Day!  Check me out. He tries to jump off the counter and land perfectly on hi board.  Wrong!  Off the board and on his ass. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Roach, I know you ain't never worked in a record shop before and you're a little excited.  But if Pinky catches you doing that X-Games shit off his counter top, we both getting fired.  You feel me? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you.  I've just been practicing that one move all week. (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was it. An unhappy CUSTOMER walks in holding a CD without the cov CUSTOMER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get jiggy with this shit. (getting loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the damn manager? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the manager stepped out for a moment.  I'm currently running the store. Can I see the CD? The customer throws the CD on the counter.  Day-Day picks up. CUSTOMER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, give me my damn money back.  Right now, and I don't have no damn receipt neither. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sir...but where's the cover? CUSTOMER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have no damn cover. Craig walks in with the notice in hand. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't give you your damn money back on this. CUSTOMER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!  I'll go postal in this mothafucka! DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you gonna have to go postal then. The customer KNOCKS over a counter display and then turns get away. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Craig bumps him and he falls into the Rap cassette rack. CUSTOMER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!  Don't hit me!  Don't hit me. He jumps up and slips on a few more cassettes on his scra out the door. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and if you come back, it's gonna be worse. Roach can't believe what just happened. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?  That was a W.W.F. hit right there, huh, Day-Day? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was.  How you get up here? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walked. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ya'll got a notice today.  It came certified mail. He gives it to Day-Day. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, this Roach.  Roach, this is my cousin, Craig. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, bro? Craig nods his head. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to wake up Uncle Elroy but he thought I was Suga. Day-Day reads the notice. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this is? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's why I walked down here. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it say? Day-Day ignores Roach. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can they do this? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Did ya'll forget to pay it or something? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it say? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since my momma died the bills are always late. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how much it is? Day-Day opens it.  A PHONE starts to RING. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, man.  Get the phone. Roach skateboards over to the phone. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinky's. Day-Day reads on. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says we owe $3,900...by tomorrow. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...how much money ya'll got left from the lottery? Day-Day goes for his bank book.  He flips a few pages. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, plan B. Day-Day is overwhelmed.  Roach skates back over. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a girl on a cell phone.  She said she's outside in the parking lot waiting for you to take her to lunch. Day-Day looks at Craig.  He runs over to the door.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE IN THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: D'Wana sits in her car with her play sister BABY'D (her n does not fit her body). DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  That's D'Wana.  And she got Baby'D with her. Day-Day locks the door and runs into the back.  Craig and Roach follow. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Wana brought Baby'D up here. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the big one, huh? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn right that's the big one. The PHONE starts to RING again.  D'Wana and Baby'D are at door.  D'Wana is on her phone.  Baby'D starts to knock. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, go out there and tell 'em I'm gone. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't trying to get in it. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already in. The knocking gets louder. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You can't handle a girl like D'Wana. It's got to be Craig.

dialogues.speaker: AT FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: They observe the "Yes We're Open" sign. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That white boy said he was in there. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day, don't make me break this window! Craig is peeking out.  He hesitates. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for Baby'D. Craig walks out the back.  He steps over the door.  Unloc it, and cracks it open. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day ain't here. They don't believe him. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his cousin. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suppose to work here now or something? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I work here now. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't come here for Day-Day. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we didn't.  We came to buy a CD. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move. Baby'D kicks the door.  Craig has no choice but to let 'e in. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that boy that told me Day-Day was here? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I think he went out the back. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I look for myself? Suddenly Roach is pushed into the front area. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, ladies. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Day-Day? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, he must've left. D'Wana looks at Baby'D. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought ya'll wanted to buy a CD? BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do... can you help me find the jazz section? Craig looks at Roach for directions.  He nods over toward the front of the store. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.  You know damn well you don't listen to no jazz. Baby'D checks out Craig as he leads the way.  D'Wana look around. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Day-Day comes back, tell him I came by and need to see him.  Lamaze classes are Wednesday. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do. D'Wana starts to walk towards Craig and Baby'D. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, 'D, let's go. But first she doubles back towards the storage room. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't the rest room this way?  I gotta pee. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. As she's walking in the back, Roach realizes his mistake.

dialogues.speaker: BACK STORAGE AREA
dialogues.text: DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Day-Day makes a run for it.  She spots him ducking out th back door. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in there!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE STORE
dialogues.text: Baby'D knocks Craig out of the way. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran out the door. Baby'D gives chase with D'Wana, Craig and Roach close beh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day runs around the side of Pinky's Records store.  H stops to see if anyone is coming.  It's Baby'D with the t others trailing.  Baby'D is chasing Day-Day all through t parking lot.  Craig, D'Wana and Roach stop to watch. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haul ass, dude.  Don't stop. ...and he is. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better stop running from that girl. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuuck -- U! He runs back towards his BMW.  The chase continues around car.  Baby'D is starting to tire. DAY-DAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma shoot yo' big ass. D'Wana watches from a distance.  Craig and Roach are clos ROACH (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves well for a big girl. Just then, out of nowhere, Karla appears behind them carr a couple of bags.  She taps Craig on his shoulder.  He tu around. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, remember me? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, I remember you. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for what my brother did this morning.  They're assholes. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool.  You ain't got to apologize for your brothers.  They're big boys. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to give you this. She hands him a card with her number on it. KARLA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my brothers wasn't so over-protective, I'd have you call the house.  But for now just page me when you get a chance. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most definitely. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better sooner than later. She picks up her shopping bags and walks away.  Over at t chase: Baby'D is winded.  She bends over trying to catch breath. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby'D, you're not going to catch me as usual.  So what can we do to end it this time?  What you want?  Another Big Pun CD?  'Cause I gotta get back to work. Baby'D looks over at Craig. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I know what I want this time. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you need. BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo' cousin, Craig.  Hook us up. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him to come over here and talk to me. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can go free? BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, fo' I change my mind. Day-Day carefully walks back over towards the store.  D'W pouts and walks towards Baby'D.  (If looks could kill.) ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great moves, Day-Day. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happen? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We worked out a deal.  All you gotta do is go over there and talk to Baby'D. Craig looks over at Baby'D.  She's waiting. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean talk to her? ROACH (still smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what he mean, dude. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gone. Craig turns and sprints into the store.  Baby'D looks concerned.  Day-Day grabs Roach and they run into the sto BABY'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma get you, Day-Day!  You gotta come out sometimes! D'Wana hands her a brick. D'WANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Baby'D screams and throws the brick through Day-Day's WINDSHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? ROACH (looking out window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wanna know. Day-Day is devastated. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Craig. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we cousins and all, but don't try an' hook me up with the big little sisters. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big bitches need love, too, Craig. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For sure.  That's how I like 'em. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they still out there? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative...they vamped. Day-Day starts to walk into the back storage area. ROACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we straighten up out here before Pinky gets back? Day-Day is like a zombie now.  He doesn't answer, just ke walking. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day? No answer.  Craig looks at Roach.  They follow.

dialogues.speaker: BACK STORAGE AREA
dialogues.text: Day-Day sits with the notice in hand. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today ain't my day. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer, huh?  And Friday is suppose to be a kick-ass day. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it is...the best day before the weekend. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fuckin' poetic, Craig. Day-Day is still sad. ROACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how you feeling.  And if I had my bong right now, I'd let you 'toke 'til you choke.'  Dude, right here.  All out. No lungs.  All I got is this. Roach pulls out a big, smashed brownie with green shit in CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the green stuff poking out? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cron-don, sir.  My mom hates for me to smoke, so she made me bud-brownies. Wanna bite? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I already ate. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Day, try it.  For moms. Day-Day shakes his head.  Craig reaches into his fifth pocket. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't a bong but, wa-la! He has the joint from this morning. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wo! Roach snatches it. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Craig snatches it back. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, bro, reflexes.  How did you do that? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black magic. Day-Day snatches the joint and puts it in his mouth. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me dat.  I'm the one with the problem. Roach pulls out a mini-skateboard that's actually a light ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weed doesn't solve problems.  It eases the mind, and the soul.  Enjoy. He lights the joint.  Day-Day takes a hit. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you smoked bud that much. DAY-DAY (letting out the smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. ROACH (taking the joint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn nigga, don't Jack the joint.  I didn't even pass it. ROACH (hitting it good)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, dude. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better open up a window or something before the smell gets out. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no windows in here. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea. He hands the joint to Craig.  Gets up and closes the door Then he grabs the vacuum out of the corner. ROACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little theory of mine... it should work. He plugs in the VACUUM and TURNS it ON.  He puts the nozz in Day-Day's face. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't gonna work. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah. Day-Day hits the 'J and blows into the nozzle.  It quickl sucks up the smoke. DAY-DAY (passing the 'J)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still gonna smell it. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  Watch this. Roach hits the joint harder than anyone else.  Smoke star to come out of his ears.  Craig and Day-Day get a kick ou that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pink limo pulls to a stop.  The chauffeur gets out wear his suit just a little too tight.  He opens the door and pair of pink boots hit the pavement.  The CAMERA PANS UP PINKY (35), the asshole owner. PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, you hittin' them goddamn corners too fast.  Slow down.  I almost spilled my Hennessy on this 300 dollar suit. He walks over to the door.  He thinks it's open.  It's no PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I be damn. He shakes the door.  It's locked.  He looks inside.  No o at the counter.  Cassettes all over the floor.  Pinky loo around making sure no one sneaks up on him.  He reaches u his shirt and pulls out a Glock 9mm.  Sticks his key in t door and steps in.

dialogues.speaker: BACK STORE AREA
dialogues.text: is upside down.  All the blood has rushed to his head.  H has Chinaman eyes and a big smile on his face. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach, what are you doing? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-U-S-H Intensely. A big cloud of smoke rolls out of his mouth and he falls hits the deck. ROACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My spleen. Craig and Day-Day laugh at Roach.  The VACUUM is still GO but the room is very smoky.  Craig jumps in. CRAIG (unplugging the vacuum)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This vacuum don't work.  Where's the restroom? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the door and to the left. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the vacuum would work.

dialogues.speaker: IN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Craig makes a left and grabs the knob.  He feels somethin pressing on the back of his head (gun). PINKY (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move or I'll blow your head smooth off. Craig throws his hands up. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now back up slowly... and don't say a word. He obeys.  Pinky backs Craig into the store. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the floor. Craig gets down. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little mothafucka trying to rob me. I'mma show you how I do 'em. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't trying to rob you... PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Fo' I pump this Glock in yo' ass!  What did you do wit Day-Day and Roach? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, Day-Day is my people! PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said shut up!  Now who sent you? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody! PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say another word, it's over.  I'm not playing! Pinky starts to pat down Craig's pockets. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't got no gun, but where's the weed at?  I smell it. Craig says nothing. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma tie you ass up! Pinky backs up and steps on Roach's skateboard.  The gun flying and so does he.  Pinky falls on his ass.  The 9mm lands in front of Craig.  There's a big scramble for the

dialogues.speaker: BACK STORAGE AREA
dialogues.text: The mood is serious. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta think of a plan to get this money before tomorrow. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could sell your Beamer. Day-Day gives Roach the evil-eye. ROACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I hope Craig got a good idea.  We gotta ask him when he comes out.  Let's go and clean up before Pinky gets here. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can ask him to loan you the money. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoooo, that's it.  You ain't as dumb as I think you are, Roach. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE STORE
dialogues.text: Pinky and Craig are still scrambling for the gun.  The st looks like a tornado hit it.  Twice.  Craig comes up with pistol.  Pinky jumps on the ground. PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill me. Craig is exhausted.  He stands over Pinky with the gun. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.  I been trying to tell yo' ass that... Day-Day is my cousin.  They're right there in the back. PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, man.  I didn't see shit.  The safe combination is 34-5-27. Just take it all. Just then, Day-Day and Roach come from the back. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, what the hell are you doing? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day, is this your cousin? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You fired...and, Roach, your fired too. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me? PINKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell weed. He looks up at Craig. PINKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you...you lucky.  I was just about to get in yo' ass.  Now give me my pistol back and get the hell out my store. Craig looks at Day-Day.  Day-Day looks back at him.  Nobo high now.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones' dog truck is weaving in and out of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones is driving and eating at the same time.  He finishes off the last few bites of his sandwich. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on, Craig.  I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Debo and Ezal are smashed inside the dog cages. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo!  Debo! DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel my legs no more. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.  How far is Rancho Cucamonga? EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The Beamer pulls into the driveway.  Our trio get out wit very long faces. CRAIG (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a strange way, I feel responsible for Day-Day getting fired.  If I wouldn't have fought Pinky, and gave Day-Day the joint, he'd still have a job. Day-Day walks into the house while Craig and Roach stay o on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy opens his bedroom door wearing a S&M mask holding a tube of KY jelly.  He removes the mask.  Day-Da hands him the notice.  Uncle Elroy takes it with his grea hands. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah damn.  Damn. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fired too. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! He starts to beat Day-Day with a sex toy.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The dog truck exits the freeway.  He pulls into a gas sta by the freeway.  He stops near the restrooms and jumps ou air freshner in hand.  When he gets to the door, it's loc MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. He knocks. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, man, hurry up.  We got an emergency out here. No answer.  Mr. Jones paces nervously. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I shouldn't have ordered that extra hot sauce.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Craig and Day-Day are trying to think.  Roach is practici skateboard moves.  He's not very good. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: He knocks again. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, man, what the hell you doing in there?  Open the door. Just then the door opens and out walks MICHAEL JORDAN. MICHAEL JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't nobody go in the bathroom for about 35, 40 minutes. Mr. Jones is stunned. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you that boy? Jordan jumps in his car and he's gone.  Mr. Jones is happ he's just seen Michael Jordan. MR. JONES (cont'd) (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that something, Michael Jordan. He walks in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Reality hits, it stinks up in there.  Mr. Jones fronds. MR. JONES (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Li'l Joker dances with other girlfriend, as an OLD SCHOOL JAM PLAYS in the B.G. other senorita is pouring herself a drink. Karla walks into the room. KARLA

dialogues.text: I be damn.

dialogues.text: Hey. DAY-DAY
