dialogues.text: Shhhh!  Roach, shut the fuck up. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this sugar shit. Something ain't right. Joker thinks for a moment.  Then he turns to Baby Joker. JOKER (cont'd) (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go check on the money. Baby Joker obeys the order. LI'L JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Karla, put the guns away. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your mouth shut. Karla walks back in. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going on? JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  What you want? KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to take me to see Mom? JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your car. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Take your car?' JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and hurry up. Karla doesn't believe it. KARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She grabs the keys off the bar. KARLA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a bit.  'Bye. She's out the door.  Joker turns to Day-Day and Roach. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everything's alright.  We might let you leave, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open.  It's Uncle Elroy. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, where the hell you been? Mr. Jones pops up.  So does Suga and Miss Ho Kym. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up, Elroy, that's my boy.  Craig, what the hell wrong with you?  Where you been? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Day-Day? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Thought he was with you. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, Uncle Elroy, I need your help. He steps in the house and closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same scene as before.  Two angry Mexicans, three half-naked Girls, plus Day-Day and Roach in the middle. Joker returns. BABY JOKER (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the money is missing. JOKER (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?! DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! (as he looks at Roach)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What that mean? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you Miyateas are staying with us. (to Baby Joker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the duct tape. (to Li'l Joker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what to do. Li'l Joker turns to the girls. LI'L JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your clothes back on. The scared Girls start to dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla backs up the rider and she's out.  The Joker house looks quiet.  Then the door opens and three Girls walk ou LI'L JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry you gotta walk, but I'll call you tomorrow. The Girls take off down the street.  The porch lights go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, Mr. Jones, Uncle Elroy, Suga and Miss Ho Kym are peeking out the window. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.  You think they're in there? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why for?  Them boys are real player haters. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.  Right now we gotta do somethin'. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come way out here to get into more trouble.  You could've stayed at home. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, shut up.  Yo' old ass need to get in a little bit o' trouble sometimes. MR. JONES (rolling up his sleeve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get it twisted, Elroy.  I ain't lost none of my street skills. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If ya'll don't come back not in ten minutes, I'mma callin' the po'lice. Craig, Uncle Elroy and Mr. Jones are about to go on a mission. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  I gotta go get my shit. Uncle Elroy runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li'l Joker is almost finished duct-taping Day-Day and Roa Baby Joker holds the AK.  Joker paces the floor.  Day-Day Roach try to make peace by singing an old "War" song.  Da Day is serious. DAY-DAY & ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Why can't we be friends?  Why can't we be friends?  Why can't we be friends? Why can't we be friends?'... DAY-DAY (still singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I hope my cousin call the C.I.A.' Joker throws a BOTTLE against the wall.  It SHATTERS into million pieces. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! The singing stops. JOKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't tell me where my money is, I'mma show you how close we can get. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money?  Man, we came over here from some sugar and rolling papers.  We was going to get high, and I was going to show this white boy how to make Kool-Aid.  That's all. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, mister Joker, have a heart, bro. It's Friday. Joker walks over to Roach and kicks him in the mouth. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hearing a lot of talking, but I'm not hearing the right words. BABY JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the other guy took it. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he take it?  He don't even know you. JOKER (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Where's that other miyatea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elroy catches up with Craig and Mr. Jones on the si of Joker's house.  He has a big chrome .357 magnum. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice piece of heat right there. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I only got two bullets in the mothafucka, but it's better than nothing. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bullets?  Yo' ass ain't changed. Back in the day, all I had was a stick. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. They sneak over to the fence. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that ugly dog? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my mase. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the other side, sleep. They start to hop the fence.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHEECO
dialogues.text: ...starts to awake.  He tries to stand up and stumbles ba on his face.  He lets out ANOTHER MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: ON CRAIG AND UNCLE ELROY
dialogues.text: Craig is over the fence.  Mr. Jones is over  But Uncle El is having a little trouble. CRAIG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some help? MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to lose some weight. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut yo' ass up. Uncle Elroy falls off the fence. UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Craig & Mr. Jones helps him up.  They creep over to t window - the shades are pulled down. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, but I think they're in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joker is getting tired of the games.  And Day-Day is plea for his life. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tape his mouth shut. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joker, a man like yourself can do a lot for this community.  By letting us go, you can improve black and brown relations. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, brown and white relations, too. Day-Day looks at Roach. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you gonna get us killed. Li'l Joker grabs Day-Day and tapes his mouth shut.  He do the same to Roach. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick and tired of bullshitting with you guys. (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby brother, go get the chainsaw. Baby Joker hands him the AK and he's gone.  Day-Day and R look terrified.  Everything has turned serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo and Ezal are still asleep.  Debo wakes first. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezal!  Ezal! EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be here 'cause we stopped. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, let's get out. They both try to get out.  But it's no way to get out fro the inside. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you get out of here. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They both start to go nuts on the door.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The dog truck is shaking like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Joker walks out the back door.  He stops in the midd of the yard. BABY JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeco!  Cheeco!  Here, boy! No Cheeco.  He continues to a shed in the back yard.  He inside and picks up a chainsaw.  On his way out the shed, he's slapped in the face with a "Big Ass Stick."  Mr. Jon is working the handle. Baby Joker is out cold.  Mr. Jones stands over him. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you got knock the fuck out. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, pops! UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, big bro.  You swung that like Sammy Sosa. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skills are still intact.  Now tie his ass up, Elroy. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terror continues. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little brother went out to get my chainsaw.  I'mma show you what happens to fools who don't tell me what I wanna hear.  You ever see Scarface, mothafucka? Day-Day starts to cry.  Roach tries to scream through the tape.  Joker turns to Li'l Joker. JOKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go see what's taking him so long. Li'l Joker obeys.  We FOLLOW Li'l Joker THROUGH the house OUT the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li'l Joker stands at the back door. LI'L JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior?!  Junior?! No answer.  Suddenly he spots something over by the shed. It's Baby Joker all ties up. LI'L JOKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... He runs to the rescue.  But right before he gets to him, Uncle Elroy jumps out the bushes and takes him.  "Ronnie Style."  Mr. Jones steps in with the stick.  Craig steps with the rope, and it's over.  Uncle Elroy's hurt.  It's back. UNCLE ELROY (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My back. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slip my disc, again... Oh got damn. Craig goes to assist Uncle Elroy. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretch it out. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joker is pissed. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are these fucking guys? He storms out the room.  Day-Day and Roach try to escape. They flap around on the ground like a fish out of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door flies open.  Joker appears with the AK-47 i hand.  He spots Uncle Elroy in the middle of the yard ben over.  He lifts the AK. JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing here? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost something, nigga.  What it look like? JOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a dead man. Out of nowhere, Craig hits Joker from the back.  He flies way and the gun flies another.  Now it's really on!  Hand hand combat.  Craig vs. Joker.  Right vs. wrong.  Good vs evil.  You know how it go. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the body, Craig!  Go to the body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day-Day and Roach have made it a little further to the do but they still look like fish searching for H2O.  Uncle E stumbles in.  He grabs a knife and starts to cut them loo UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, Day-Day, I'mma kick yo' ass for getting me into this mess and hurting my back!  I moved out here to get away from this kinda shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight's still on.  Craig is giving Joker the ass-whipping deserves when Uncle Elroy, Day-Day and Roach reach the ba porch. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em, Craig! ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite his ear! UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What 'em!  Watch 'em! Joker takes a few more shots from Craig, then grabs Craig around the waist and slams him to the ground.  Craig is h UNCLE ELROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off yo' back, Craig! Craig struggles with Joker, who now has the devil in his eyes. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll mothafuckas help me! Day-Day and Roach look at each other.  They rush to Craig aide.  Joker spots them coming, he also spots the AK. In SLOW MOTION, Day-Day and Roach dive on Joker...at the time Joker dives for the AK.  Day-Day and Roach land on t of Craig and our trio try to hurry to their feet.  But as soon as they get up, they're looking down the barrel of a 47. JOKER (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to my little friend.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Debo hits Joker from the back.  Joker is out cold. DEBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Jose.  This one is mine. Ezal picks up the gun and hands it to Debo. DEBO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Craig, remember me? Craig knows he can't fight a gun.  Everybody is helpless. can hear SIRENS getting CLOSER and CLOSER.  Suddenly, out nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: CHEECO
dialogues.text: The pitbull is back!  And he's mad as hell.  He runs thro everybody and jumps on Debo, knocking the gun from his ha Craig and Day-Day jump on Debo.  Roach WHISTLES, and Chee stops his attack on Debo. Cheeco runs over to Roach and jumps in his arms.  Roach's being licked to death by the pitbull. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally you got a bitch, huh, Roach? ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a boy, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out front, three sheriff cars swoop into the driveway.  T cops jump out, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debo and Ezal are tied up next to the Jokers. EZAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones, we was just playin'.  He made me do it. Mr. Jones don't wanna hear it.  Craig runs into the house Uncle, Day-Day, Roach and Cheeco look at the five on the ground...it's over, or is it? SHERIFF #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, Sheriff's Department! The SHERIFFS are on our heroes, guns drawn. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!  I live across the street! SHERIFF LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Paid cash. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They the ones you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red and Blue lights flash through the neighborhood.  Ever is out their door looking at the action.  The suburbs is starting to look like the ghetto for real. Uncle Elroy is bent over. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my back gets better I'mma beat the black off you, Day-Day. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I'm sorry. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, my ass. Suga and Miss Ho Kym come running. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elroy, what happen? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threw my back, again. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, no lovin' tonight? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, baby, no lovin' tonight. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby, let's go in the house. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  We ain't gonna have no house after the auction tomorrow! Everyone is sad. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, bro, you, Suga, Day-Day and Craig can live with me and my parents. 'Til you get back on yo' feet. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Roach, but I can't accept that. We're moving back to Watts where it's safe. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Craig? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boy just don't never learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig steps out of Joker's front door carrying the chrome hydraulic pump. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Fridays. He walks past the cops and crosses the street. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he go. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he carrying? DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Property taxes, and a new candy-apple paint job. They greet Craig and all start to walk towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Jefferson's" theme song, "Movin' On Up," PLAYS on th TV.  Uncle Elroy is face down on the floor looking at the Miss Ho Kym walks on his back with her shoes off.  He moa in pleasure.  Mr. Jones eats chicken wings. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump up and down on him. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's next. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to him.  How much we got? Suga is at the table counting money.  She takes a few hundreds for herself. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got forty-seven thousand, three hundred and fifteen dollars. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a whole lot of scrilla. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna feel good to pay my taxes. Craig is tending to his wounds. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Unc. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do nothing. Roach and Cheeco are about to leave.  He has a handful of money. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, I'm outta here. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the help. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, the pleasure's all mine. Thanks for the dog, and the money.  Maybe my dad won't kick my ass tonight. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, later, bro.  Hey, Craig, nice smokin' wit'cha. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smokin' what? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. ROACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, Mr. Jones.  Bye, Suga. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Roach. Roach is gone.  Day-Day shuts the door.  Miss Ho Kym is finished.  She steps off of Uncle Elroy. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done.  Stand up. Uncle Elroy gets up.  He's better. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that George Jefferson shit works. Thanks, Miss Kym. Uncle Elroy walks over to the table and grabs a stack of hundred-dollar bills.  He hands it to Miss Ho Kym. MISS HO KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't accept. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better take this money. She takes the money. MISS HO KYM (in Korean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take a trip back to Korea now. Find a freak daddy, bring him back to America.  Make 'em my bitch. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go, girl. Uncle Elroy helps Miss Ho Kym out the door. MR. JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we better hit the road, too. Craig, get your stuff. UNCLE ELROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Craig, you're welcome anytime. Suga hugs Craig. SUGA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, baby, it's a shame you leavin'. Aunt Suga gonna miss yo. And the others have to agree. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't wanna stay? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm got live ghetto fabulous.  make sure you get that car fixed. DAY-DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.  When can I come visit? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Probably next Friday. They're out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we PULL BACK, all is well inside and outside Uncle Elr house.  The suburbs are back to normal.  They get in the Craig looks over at the Joker's house.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Karla pulls up in the low-rider.  They lock eyes and she blows him a kiss.  He gives her a wink.  They pull off. goes in the house. CRAIG (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all's well that ends well.  Another Friday gone.  Another problem solved. It's a trip to know that things can get crazy in the suburbs, too.  I can't wait to get back home...to the peace and quiet streets of South Central. D'Wana's car pulls INTO FRAME.  She stops in front of Unc Elroy's house.  Baby'D jumps out with a brick.  She throw through the back window of Day-Day's BMW.  She jumps back and they're gone...
